com.undercamber

Class Configurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.undercamber.Configurator

  • public final class Configurator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class configures a test system in Undercamber.

    The strings passed into this class are automatically expanded using environment variables. To have a string expanded, use the %{...} notation, similar to parameter expansion in Linux.

    See Also:
    ConfigurationCallback

    • Method Detail

      • setSuiteName

        public final Configurator setSuiteName(java.lang.String suiteName)
                                throws UserError,
                                       InternalException
        Set the name of the overall suite.

        This is equivalent to

            setSuiteName( suiteName,
                  ValidationLevel.ERROR );
        Parameters:
        suiteName - The name
        Returns:
        This Configurator, for chaining
        Throws:
        UserError - If the name is not valid, or if the string is improperly formatted for expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setSuiteName

        public final Configurator setSuiteName(java.lang.String suiteName,
                                       ValidationLevel validationLevel)
                                throws UserError,
                                       InternalException
        Set the name of the overall suite.

        Parameters:
        suiteName - The name.
        validationLevel - The validation level to use when expanding the string.
        Returns:
        This Configurator, for chaining
        Throws:
        UserError - If the name is not valid, or if the string is improperly formatted for expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setResultsRootDirectoryName

        public final Configurator setResultsRootDirectoryName(java.lang.String directoryName)
                                               throws UserError,
                                                      InternalException
        Set the name of the root results directory.

        This is equivalent to

            setResultsRootDirectoryName( directoryName,
                                 ValidationLevel.ERROR );
        Unlike setResultsRootDirectory(java.io.File), this method uses string expansion.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - The name of the directory.
        Returns:
        This Configurator, for chaining
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is improperly formatted for expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setResultsRootDirectoryName

        public final Configurator setResultsRootDirectoryName(java.lang.String directoryName,
                                                      ValidationLevel validationLevel)
                                               throws UserError,
                                                      InternalException
        Set the name of the root results directory.

        Unlike setResultsRootDirectory(java.io.File), this method uses string expansion.

        Parameters:
        directoryName - The name of the directory.
        validationLevel - The validation level to use when expanding the name.
        Returns:
        This Configurator, for chaining
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is improperly formatted for expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setResultsRootDirectory

        public final Configurator setResultsRootDirectory(java.io.File directory)
        Set the root results directory. Unlike setResultsRootDirectoryName(java.lang.String), this method does not use string expansion.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory.
        Returns:
        This Configurator, for chaining

        public final Configurator setPass1ThreadCount(java.lang.Integer threadCount)

        Parameters:
        threadCount - The number of threads. If this is null, Undercamber will use a default value.
        Returns:
        This Configurator, for chaining

        public final java.lang.Integer getPass1ThreadCount()
        Get the number of threads used for the first pass (the discovery pass).
        Returns:
        The thread count. If this is null, Undercamber will use a default value.

        Should the results window be shown?

      • getFollowingCommandLineParameterAsString

        public final java.lang.String getFollowingCommandLineParameterAsString(java.lang.String parameter)
                                                                throws UserError
        Get the command-line parameter parameter following the specified parameter. This is a convenience method to help parse the test parameters. For example, if the command-line parameters include a flag/value pair, this method can provide the value, given the flag.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The name of the specified parameter
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter immediately following the specified parameter
        Throws:
        UserError - If the specified parameter does not exist, or if the specified parameter is the last in the list of parameters.

      • getFollowingCommandLineParameterAsInteger

        public final int getFollowingCommandLineParameterAsInteger(java.lang.String parameter)
                                                    throws UserError
        Get the command-line parameter following the specified parameter, interpreted as an integer. This is a convenience method to help parse the test parameters. For example, if the command-line parameters include a flag/value pair, this method can provide the value, given the flag.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The name of the specified parameter
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter immediately following the specified parameter
        Throws:
        UserError - If the specified parameter does not exist, or if the specified parameter is the last in the list of parameters, or if the parameter is not an integer.

      • getFollowingCommandLineParameterAsLong

        public final long getFollowingCommandLineParameterAsLong(java.lang.String parameter)
                                                  throws UserError
        Get the command-line parameter following the specified parameter,interpreted as a long. This is a convenience method to help parse the test parameters. For example, if the command-line parameters include a flag/value pair, this method can provide the value, given the flag.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The name of the specified parameter
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter immediately following the specified parameter
        Throws:
        UserError - If the specified parameter does not exist, or if the specified parameter is the last in the list of parameters, or if the parameter is not a long.

      • containsCommandLineParameter

        public final boolean containsCommandLineParameter(java.lang.String parameter)
        Determine whether a command-line parameter is present. This is a convenience method to help determine if a simple flag is present on the command line.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The parameter name
        Returns:
           true: The specified parameter is present
           false: The specified parameter is not present
